body_html: I think the reason why this is happening is that the backwards pass for indexing (y[mask]) returns a tensor that has 0's in it for the masked-out indices. 0 * float('inf') gives nan, which is why the nan is showing up instead of 0.
body_text: I think the reason why this is happening is that the backwards pass for indexing (y[mask]) returns a tensor that has 0's in it for the masked-out indices. 0 * float('inf') gives nan, which is why the nan is showing up instead of 0.
body: I think the reason why this is happening is that the backwards pass for indexing (`y[mask]`) returns a tensor that has 0's in it for the masked-out indices. 0 * float('inf') gives `nan`, which is why the nan is showing up instead of 0.
